metadata.titleCn: 基于世界土壤数据库（HWSD v1.2）的泛第三极土壤数据集
metadata.description:
Soil data is important both on a global scale and on a local scale, and due to the lack of reliable soil data, land degradation assessments, environmental impact studies, and sustainable land management interventions have received significant bottlenecks . Affected by the urgent need for soil information data around the world, especially in the context of the Climate Change Convention, the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA) and the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and the Kyoto Protocol for Soil Carbon Measurement and FAO/International The Global Agroecological Assessment Study (GAEZ v3.0) jointly established the Harmonized World Soil Database version 1.2 (HWSD V1.2). Among them, the data source in China is the second national land in 1995. Investigate 1:1,000,000 soil data provided by Nanjing Soil. The resolution is 30 seconds (about 0.083 degrees, 1km). The soil classification system used is mainly FAO-90.

The core soil system unit unique verification identifier:
MU_GLOBAL-HWSD database soil mapping unit identifier, connected to the GIS layer.
MU_SOURCE1 and MU_SOURCE2 source database drawing unit identifiers
SEQ-soil unit sequence in the composition of the soil mapping unit;
The soil classification system utilizes the FAO-7 classification system or the FAO-90 classification system (SU_SYM74 resp. SU_SYM90) or FAO-85 (SU_SYM85).
The main fields of the soil property sheet include:
ID (database ID)
MU_GLOBAL (Soil Unit Identifier) ​​(Global)
SU_SYMBOL soil drawing unit
SU_SYM74 (FAO74 classification);
SU_SYM85 (FAO85 classification);
SU_SYM90 (name of soil in the FAO90 soil classification system);
SU_CODE soil charting unit code
SU_CODE74 soil unit name
SU_CODE85 soil unit name
SU_CODE90 soil unit name
DRAINAGE (19.5);
REF_DEPTH (soil reference depth);
AWC_CLASS(19.5);
AWC_CLASS (effective soil water content);
PHASE1: Real (soil phase);
PHASE2: String (soil phase);
ROOTS: String (depth classification to the bottom of the soil);
SWR: String (soil moisture content);
ADD_PROP: Real (specific soil type in the soil unit related to agricultural use);
T_TEXTURE (top soil texture);
T_GRAVEL: Real (top gravel volume percentage); (unit: %vol.)
T_SAND: Real (top sand content); (unit: % wt.)
T_SILT: Real (surface layer sand content); (unit: % wt.)
T_CLAY: Real (top clay content); (unit: % wt.)
T_USDA_TEX: Real (top layer USDA soil texture classification); (unit: name)
T_REF_BULK: Real (top soil bulk density); (unit: kg/dm3.)
T_OC: Real (top organic carbon content); (unit: % weight)
T_PH_H2O: Real (top pH) (unit: -log(H+))
T_CEC_CLAY: Real (cation exchange capacity of the top adhesive layer soil); (unit: cmol/kg)
T_CEC_SOIL: Real (cation exchange capacity of top soil) (unit: cmol/kg)
T_BS: Real (top level basic saturation); (unit: %)
T_TEB: Real (top exchangeable base); (unit: cmol/kg)
T_CACO3: Real (top carbonate or lime content) (unit: % weight)
T_CASO4: Real (top sulfate content); (unit: % weight)
T_ESP: Real (top exchangeable sodium salt); (unit: %)
T_ECE: Real (top conductivity). (Unit: dS/m)
S_GRAVEL: Real (bottom crushed stone volume percentage); (unit: %vol.)
S_SAND: Real (bottom sand content); (unit: % wt.)
S_SILT: Real (bottom sludge content); (unit: % wt.)
S_CLAY: Real (bottom clay content); (unit: % wt.)
S_USDA_TEX: Real (bottom USDA soil texture classification); (unit: name)
S_REF_BULK: Real (bottom soil bulk density); (unit: kg/dm3.)
S_OC: Real (underlying organic carbon content); (unit: % weight)
S_PH_H2O: Real (bottom pH) (unit: -log(H+))
S_CEC_CLAY: Real (cation exchange capacity of the underlying adhesive layer soil); (unit: cmol/kg)
S_CEC_SOIL: Real (cation exchange capacity of the bottom soil) (unit: cmol/kg)
S_BS: Real (underlying basic saturation); (unit: %)
S_TEB: Real (underlying exchangeable base); (unit: cmol/kg)
S_CACO3: Real (bottom carbonate or lime content) (unit: % weight)
S_CASO4: Real (bottom sulfate content); (unit: % weight)
S_ESP: Real (underlying exchangeable sodium salt); (unit: %)
S_ECE: Real (underlying conductivity). (Unit: dS/m)
The database is divided into two layers, with the top layer (T) soil thickness (0-30 cm) and the bottom layer (S) soil thickness (30-100 cm).
For other attribute values, please refer to the HWSD1.2_documentation documentation.pdf, The Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD V1.2) Viewer-Chinese description and HWSD.mdb.
metadata.descriptionCn:
无论从全球尺度亦或是局地尺度而言，土壤数据极其重要，而由于缺乏可靠的土壤数据，土地退化评估、环境影响研究和可持续的土地管理干预措施收到了极大的瓶颈阻碍。受到土壤信息数据在全世界的迫切需要，特别是在气候变化公约的背景下，国际应用系统分析研究所（IIASA）及联合国粮农组织（FAO）和京都协议对土壤碳测量和联合国粮农组织/国际全球农业生态评价研究(GAEZ v3.0)共同倡导下建立了新一代世界土壤数据库(Harmonized World Soil Database version 1.2 )(HWSD V1.2)。其中，中国地区数据源为1995年全国第二次土地调查由南京土壤所所提供的1:1,000,000土壤数据。分辨率为30秒（约0.083度，1km）。采用的土壤分类系统主要为FAO-90。

核心土壤制度单元唯一验证标识符：
MU_GLOBAL-HWSD数据库土壤制图单元标示符，连接了GIS图层。
MU_SOURCE1 和 MU_SOURCE2- 源数据库制图单元标识符
SEQ-土壤制图单元组成中的土壤单元序列；
土壤分类系统利用FAO-7分类系统或 FAO-90分类系统(SU_SYM74 resp. SU_SYM90)或FAO-85(SU_SYM85).
土壤属性表主要字段包括：
ID(数据库ID)
MU_GLOBAL(土壤单元标识符)（全球）
SU_SYMBOL 土壤制图单元
SU_SYM74(FAO74分类);
SU_SYM85(FAO85分类);
SU_SYM90（FAO90土壤分类系统中土壤名称)；
SU_CODE 土壤制图单元代码
SU_CODE74 土壤单元名称
SU_CODE85 土壤单元名称
SU_CODE90 土壤单元名称
DRAINAGE(19.5);
REF_DEPTH(土壤参考深度);
AWC_CLASS(19.5);
AWC_CLASS(土壤有效水含量);
PHASE1: Real (土壤相位);
PHASE2: String (土壤相位)；
ROOTS: String (到土壤底部存在障碍的深度分类)；
SWR: String (土壤含水量特征)；
ADD_PROP: Real (土壤单元中与农业用途有关的特定土壤类型)；
T_TEXTURE(顶层土壤质地);
T_GRAVEL: Real (顶层碎石体积百分比)；(单位：%vol.)
T_SAND: Real (顶层沙含量)； (单位：% wt.)
T_SILT: Real (表层粉沙粒含量)； (单位：% wt.)
T_CLAY: Real (顶层粘土含量)； (单位：% wt.)
T_USDA_TEX: Real (顶层USDA土壤质地分类)； (单位：name)
T_REF_BULK: Real (顶层土壤容重)； (单位：kg/dm3.)
T_OC: Real (顶层有机碳含量)； (单位：% weight)
T_PH_H2O: Real (顶层酸碱度) (单位：-log(H+))
T_CEC_CLAY: Real (顶层粘性层土壤的阳离子交换能力)； (单位：cmol/kg)
T_CEC_SOIL: Real (顶层土壤的阳离子交换能力) (单位：cmol/kg)
T_BS: Real (顶层基本饱和度)； (单位：%)
T_TEB: Real (顶层交换性盐基)；(单位：cmol/kg)
T_CACO3: Real (顶层碳酸盐或石灰含量) (单位：% weight)
T_CASO4: Real (顶层硫酸盐含量)；(单位：% weight)
T_ESP: Real (顶层可交换钠盐)；(单位：%)
T_ECE: Real (顶层电导率)。 (单位：dS/m)
S_GRAVEL: Real (底层碎石体积百分比)；(单位：%vol.)
S_SAND: Real (底层沙含量)； (单位：% wt.)
S_SILT: Real (底层淤泥含量)； (单位：% wt.)
S_CLAY: Real (底层粘土含量)； (单位：% wt.)
S_USDA_TEX: Real (底层USDA土壤质地分类)； (单位：name)
S_REF_BULK: Real (底层土壤容重)； (单位：kg/dm3.)
S_OC: Real (底层有机碳含量)； (单位：% weight)
S_PH_H2O: Real (底层酸碱度) (单位：-log(H+))
S_CEC_CLAY: Real (底层粘性层土壤的阳离子交换能力)； (单位：cmol/kg)
S_CEC_SOIL: Real (底层土壤的阳离子交换能力) (单位：cmol/kg)
S_BS: Real (底层基本饱和度)； (单位：%)
S_TEB: Real (底层交换性盐基)；(单位：cmol/kg)
S_CACO3: Real (底层碳酸盐或石灰含量) (单位：% weight)
S_CASO4: Real (底层硫酸盐含量)；(单位：% weight)
S_ESP: Real (底层可交换钠盐)；(单位：%)
S_ECE: Real (底层电导率)。 (单位：dS/m)
本数据库分两层，其中以顶层（T）土壤厚度为（0-30cm），底层（S）土壤厚度为（30-100cm）。
其他属性值请参考说明HWSD1.2_documentation文档.pdf，The Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD V1.2) Viewer-中文说明及HWSD.mdb。

HWSD.mdb记录土壤数据库各个单元标识符对应的土壤参数。
根据格点上的MU_global值在数据库中找到对应的土壤参数。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of how a soil database might incorporate various soil classification systems and attributes for comprehensive environmental impact studies?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个土壤数据库如何整合各种土壤分类系统和属性以进行全面环境影响研究的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: The Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD V1.2) is an example that integrates soil classification systems such as FAO-7, FAO-85, and FAO-90 to provide a detailed account of soil attributes. It includes various soil properties like soil texture, organic carbon content, and cation exchange capacity, which are crucial for assessing environmental impacts and land management strategies.
Example.AnswerCn: 《协调世界土壤数据库》（HWSD V1.2）是一个整合了土壤分类系统，如FAO-7、FAO-85和FAO-90的例子，提供了土壤属性的详细信息。它包括各种土壤特性，如土壤质地、有机碳含量和阳离子交换容量，这些特性对于评估环境影响和土地管理策略至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD v1.2) and how does it contribute to soil data collection and analysis?
Definition.QuestionCn: 和谐世界土壤数据库（HWSD v1.2）是什么，它如何促进土壤数据的收集和分析？
Definition.AnswerEn: The Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD v1.2) is a comprehensive global soil database developed through a collaboration between the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA), the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), and other partners. It addresses the need for reliable soil data for land degradation assessment, environmental impact studies, and sustainable land management interventions. The database integrates soil data from various sources, including the 1995 National Land Survey in China, providing a resolution of 30 seconds (approximately 0.083 degrees, or 1 km). It uses the FAO-90 soil classification system, among others, and includes a range of soil attributes for both topsoil (0-30 cm) and subsoil (30-100 cm) layers, such as organic carbon content, pH, cation exchange capacity, and more.
Definition.AnswerCn: 《协调世界土壤数据库》（HWSD v1.2）是一个全面的全球土壤数据库，由国际应用系统分析研究所（IIASA）、联合国粮食及农业组织（FAO）及其他合作伙伴共同开发。该数据库满足了对可靠土壤数据的需求，以便进行土地退化评估、环境影响研究和可持续土地管理干预。数据库整合了来自多个来源的土壤数据，包括1995年中国国家土地调查，分辨率为30秒（大约0.083度，或1公里）。它使用FAO-90土壤分类系统等，并包括一系列土壤属性，涵盖表层土壤（0-30厘米）和亚层土壤（30-100厘米），如有机碳含量、pH值、阳离子交换容量等。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying reasons for the challenges faced in collecting reliable soil data for assessing land degradation and environmental impacts on a global scale?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在全球范围内评估土地退化和环境影响时，收集可靠土壤数据面临的挑战的根本原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting reliable soil data stem from the lack of consistent and comprehensive soil information, which hinders accurate land degradation assessments and environmental impact studies. The need for standardized soil data is especially critical in the context of global initiatives like climate change agreements. Efforts to address these challenges involve the creation of harmonized soil databases, such as the Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD v1.2), which integrates data from various sources, including national surveys and international collaborations, to improve data reliability and accessibility.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 收集可靠土壤数据的挑战源于缺乏一致和全面的土壤信息，这妨碍了准确的土地退化评估和环境影响研究。在气候变化协议等全球倡议的背景下，对标准化土壤数据的需求尤为迫切。为了解决这些挑战，创建了协调土壤数据库，例如协调世界土壤数据库（HWSD v1.2），该数据库整合了来自各种来源的数据，包括国家调查和国际合作，以提高数据的可靠性和可获取性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives of developing a new generation of global soil databases like the Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD V1.2), and how do these objectives address challenges in global soil data reliability and land management?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 开发新一代全球土壤数据库（如协调世界土壤数据库HWSD V1.2）的主要目标是什么，这些目标如何应对全球土壤数据可靠性和土地管理中的挑战？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives of developing a new generation of global soil databases like the Harmonized World Soil Database (HWSD V1.2) include providing reliable and comprehensive soil data that are crucial for global and local-scale assessments of land degradation, environmental impact studies, and sustainable land management interventions. Due to the lack of reliable soil data, these fields face significant bottlenecks. The HWSD V1.2 aims to meet the urgent need for soil information worldwide, especially under the context of climate change conventions. This effort is supported by institutions such as the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA), the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), and the Kyoto Protocol, focusing on soil carbon measurement and assessments through collaborative initiatives like the Global Agro-Ecological Zones (GAEZ v3.0).
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发新一代全球土壤数据库（如协调世界土壤数据库HWSD V1.2）的主要目标包括提供可靠和全面的土壤数据，这些数据对于全球和地方尺度的土地退化评估、环境影响研究以及可持续土地管理干预至关重要。由于缺乏可靠的土壤数据，这些领域面临着重大瓶颈。HWSD V1.2旨在满足全球范围内对土壤信息的迫切需求，特别是在气候变化公约的背景下。该努力得到了国际应用系统分析研究所（IIASA）、联合国粮食及农业组织（FAO）和京都议定书等机构的支持，重点关注通过全球农业生态区（GAEZ v3.0）等合作倡议进行土壤碳测量和评估。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key procedures and steps involved in harmonizing diverse soil data sources to create a comprehensive global soil database, and how can such procedures address challenges related to data reliability and resolution?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 将不同的土壤数据源进行协调，以创建一个全面的全球土壤数据库的关键程序和步骤包括哪些？这些程序如何解决与数据可靠性和分辨率相关的挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To harmonize diverse soil data sources for creating a comprehensive global soil database, the process involves standardizing soil classification systems, such as using the FAO-90 classification. Data from various regional surveys, like the 1995 national land survey in China, are integrated by matching soil mapping unit identifiers across different scales and resolutions. The use of consistent identifiers like MU_GLOBAL ensures linkage with GIS layers. Attributes are carefully standardized, with core soil parameters such as texture, organic carbon content, and pH being measured and recorded uniformly. Challenges such as varying data quality and resolution are tackled through methods like using a common resolution (30 seconds, approximately 1km) and validating data against international standards and reference documents like HWSD1.2_documentation.pdf. This procedural standardization helps in improving data reliability and addressing resolution disparities.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了整合多样的土壤数据源，以创建一个全面的全球土壤数据库，过程涉及标准化土壤分类系统，例如使用FAO-90分类。来自各个区域调查的数据，如1995年中国的国家土地调查，通过匹配不同尺度和分辨率的土壤制图单元标识符进行整合。使用一致的标识符如MU_GLOBAL确保与GIS图层的链接。属性经过仔细标准化，核心土壤参数如土壤质地、有机碳含量和pH值被统一测量和记录。面对数据质量和分辨率差异等挑战，通过使用共同分辨率（30秒，约1公里）和根据国际标准及参考文献（如HWSD1.2_documentation.pdf）验证数据等方法来应对。这种程序标准化有助于提高数据的可靠性，并解决分辨率差异问题。
